result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick Maurice Whitelaw

records.addlTxt: Case called, no appearance by either party. Court received and reviewed documents from MPS in regards to Defense's Motion For Pupil Records ahead of October 6, 2022 Motion hearing.Court ordered school records to be filed and sealed.

Defendant Derrick Maurice Whitelaw appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Derrick Maurice Whitelaw.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski appeared in court on behalf of  Attorney Emily S Zimmel for State of Wisconsin. 

Case recalled.  Discussion placed on the record. Case in court on defense motion for pupil records..  Motion hearing held. Court hears argument. Court places findings on the record.  For reasons as set forth, Court DENIES defense's motion. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due 48 hours in advance of the Final PreTrial date. Any evidentiary motions should be filed by November 4, 2022. Any responses if any should be filed by November 23, 2022. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 45. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 8:30 am. Hearing will be held in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility. 
Jury Trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am. Trial will be held in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Derrick Maurice Whitelaw not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Derrick Maurice Whitelaw.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski appeared in court on behalf of  Attorney Emily S Zimmel for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court regarding Motion for Pupil records. Court passed case to address the Courts Calendar.

Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court, defendant Derrick Maurice Whitelaw not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for Attorney Emily Zimmel for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  State to provide an offer to the Defense.  Discussion held regarding State's Motion for Pupil Records.  Court GRANTS the motion.  Subpoena to be issued and records to be submitted to the Court for "in camera" court-only review.  Court sets this for adjourned Scheduling Conference.  Case adjourned to Br. 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Maurice Whitelaw in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Derrick Maurice Whitelaw in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared on behalf of Emily Zimmel for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick Maurice Whitelaw appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense is in receipt of discovery and requests a scheduling conference.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion for Dismissal (Derrick Whitelaw # 2022006158 HOC - 8885 S. 68TH Street Franklin, WI. 53132)

Defendant Derrick Maurice Whitelaw in court with Attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Derrick Maurice Whitelaw in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Klauser. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Case re-scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing on 07/13/2022 at 08:30 am, in Prelim Court.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Derrick Maurice Whitelaw in court, in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Hearing, pursuant to State V. Lee.  Public Defender's Office has not Appointed Counsel.  Case scheduled for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Maurice Whitelaw not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing. Matter to be heard in Br. 15 Judge Watts for Br. 34 Judge Yamahiro.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BUW (DOB: 9/24/2008), and MNW.

Defendant Derrick Maurice Whitelaw in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Derrick Maurice Whitelaw in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick Maurice Whitelaw appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
